text: Programming today is a race between software engineers striving to build bigger and better idiot-proof programs, and the Universe trying to produce bigger and better idiots. So far, the Universe is winning.
author: Rick Cook

text: I don't care if it works on your machine! We are not shipping your machine!
author: Vidiu Platon

text: Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
author: John Woods

text: Without requirements or design, programming is the art of adding bugs to an empty text file.
author: Louis Srygley

text: Theory is when you know everything but nothing works. Practice is when everything works but no one knows why. In our lab, theory and practice are combined: nothing works and no one knows why.
author: Anonymous

text: 6 hours of debugging can save you 5 minutes of reading documentation.
author: Anonymous

text: I have a joke about CSS, but I can't get it to center.
author: Anonymous

text: Why do programmers wear glasses? Because they don't C#.
author: Anonymous

text: A SQL query walks into a bar, walks up to two tables and asks, 'Can I join you?'
author: Anonymous

text: How to rescue a trapped developer? git checkout -f
author: Anonymous

text: There are 10 types of people in the world: those who understand binary, and those who don't.
author: Anonymous

text: I tried to exit Vim, but I'm still here. Send help.
author: Anonymous

text: The heaviest object in the universe: node_modules.
author: Anonymous

text: A Junior Dev fixes a bug. A Senior Dev deletes the code that caused the bug.
author: Anonymous

text: Why did the developer go broke? Because he used up all his cache.
author: Anonymous

text: In Git, 'force push' is just a fancy way of saying 'I am right and everyone else is wrong.'
author: Anonymous

text: Q: How many programmers does it take to screw in a light bulb? A: None. It's a hardware problem.
author: Anonymous

text: Weeks of coding can save you hours of planning.
author: Anonymous

text: Wait, you guys are getting paid? - The intern who just dropped the prod DB.
author: Meme

text: Debugging is like being the detective in a crime movie where you are also the murderer.
author: Filipe Fortes

text: The best thing about a boolean is even if you are wrong, you are only off by a bit.
author: Anonymous

text: My code doesn't work, I have no idea why. My code works, I have no idea why.
author: Every Developer

text: Real programmers count from 0.
author: Anonymous

text: One does not simply merge into master.
author: Boromir

text: JavaScript: '1' + '1' = '11'. '1' - '1' = 0. Logic left the chat.
author: Anonymous

text: The only valid measurement of code quality: WTFs/minute.
author: Thom Holwerda

text: Remember: The more you weigh, the harder you are to kidnap. Stay safe. Eat cake.
author: Security Advisor

text: Why do Java developers wear glasses? Because they don't C#.
author: Classic

text: The problem with troubleshooting is that trouble shoots back.
author: Anonymous

text: If at first you don't succeed, call it version 1.0.
author: Anonymous

text: I would tell you a UDP joke, but you might not get it.
author: Networking Nerd

text: There are only two hard things in Computer Science: cache invalidation and naming things.
author: Phil Karlton

text: Don't worry if it doesn't work right. If everything did, you'd be out of a job.
author: Mosher's Law

text: A user interface is like a joke. If you have to explain it, it's not that good.
author: Martin LeBlanc

text: Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
author: Edward V. Berard

text: Programmer: A machine that turns coffee into code.
author: Anonymous

text: I'm not a great programmer; I'm just a good programmer with great habits.
author: Kent Beck

text: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: John Johnson

text: It works on my machine.
author: Famous Last Words

text: Deleted code is debugged code.
author: Jeff Sickel

text: If debugging is the process of removing bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

text: The first 90% of the code accounts for the first 90% of the development time. The remaining 10% of the code accounts for the other 90% of the development time.
author: Tom Cargill

text: Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable.
author: Ralph Johnson

text: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
author: Kent Beck

text: I'm not lazy, I'm just on energy saving mode.
author: Anonymous

text: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Knowledge is knowing a tomato is a fruit; Wisdom is not putting it in a fruit salad.
author: Miles Kington

text: Perfection is achieved not when there is nothing more to add, but rather when there is nothing more to take away.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

text: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.
author: Austin Freeman

text: Code never lies, comments sometimes do.
author: Ron Jeffries

text: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
author: Martin Fowler

text: Java is to JavaScript what Car is to Carpet.
author: Anonymous

text: Optimism is an occupational hazard of programming: feedback is the treatment.
author: Kent Beck

text: When in doubt, use brute force.
author: Ken Thompson

text: Unix is simple. It just takes a genius to understand its simplicity.
author: Dennis Ritchie

text: Hardware: The parts of a computer system that can be kicked.
author: Jeff Pesis

text: Documentation is like sex: when it is good, it is very, very good; and when it is bad, it is better than nothing.
author: Dick Brandon

text: Most software today is very like an Egyptian pyramid with millions of bricks piled on top of each other, with no structural integrity, but just done by brute force and thousands of slaves.
author: Alan Kay

text: I think Microsoft named .Net so it wouldn’t show up in a Unix directory listing.
author: Oktal

text: If Python is executable pseudocode, then Perl is executable line noise.
author: Anonymous

text: Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.
author: Bill Gates

text: The computer was born to solve problems that did not exist before.
author: Bill Gates

text: Software is like entropy: It is difficult to grasp, weighs nothing, and obeys the Second Law of Thermodynamics; i.e., it always increases.
author: Norman Augustine

text: Ideally, code should be poetry. In reality, it's often a ransom note.
author: Anonymous

text: Programming is 10% writing code and 90% understanding why it’s not working.
author: Anonymous

text: I hate programming. I hate programming. I hate programming. It works! I love programming.
author: Every Dev Ever

text: QA Engineer walks into a bar. Orders a beer. Orders 0 beers. Orders 999999999 beers. Orders a lizard. Orders -1 beers. Orders a ueicbksjdhd. First real customer walks in and asks where the bathroom is. The bar bursts into flames.
author: QA Humor

text: A good programmer looks both ways before crossing a one-way street.
author: Doug Linder

text: Why do we call it 'hypertext'? Because 'supertext' sounded too pretentious.
author: Ted Nelson

text: C++: An octopus made by nailing extra legs onto a dog.
author: Steve Taylor

text: Software undergoes beta testing shortly before it's released. Beta is Latin for 'still doesn't work'.
author: Anonymous

text: There are two major products that come out of Berkeley: LSD and UNIX. We don't believe this to be a coincidence.
author: Jeremy S. Anderson

text: The code is the documentation.
author: A Lazy Developer

text: Programming without a heavy architecture design is like exploring a cave with a flashlight that’s slowly running out of batteries.
author: Anonymous

text: Sometimes I think the compiler is just ignoring my comments.
author: Anonymous

text: My code is self-documenting. It documents my descent into madness.
author: Anonymous

text: Full Stack Developer: Someone who can introduce bugs in the database, backend, and frontend.
author: Anonymous

text: Dark theme is not a preference, it's a lifestyle.
author: Anonymous

text: Why did I divide by zero? Just to see what would happen.
author: Junior Dev

text: Copying code from Stack Overflow is not stealing. It's ... sharing.

text: Cloud computing is just using someone else's computer.

text: Two threads walk into a bar. The bartender says, 'Can I get you a drink?' The first thread says 'Yes'. The second thread says 'I'll have a race condition.'
author: Anonymous

text: Recursion: See 'Recursion'.
author: Dictionary

text: I am not a robot. I am a large language model trained by Google.
author: AI

text: To understand what recursion is, you must first understand recursion.
author: Anonymous

text: Big O Notation: How your code slows down as your data grows up.
author: Anonymous

text: Regular expressions: Now you have two problems.
author: Jamie Zawinski

text: Perl: The only language that looks the same before and after RSA encryption.
author: Keith Bostic

text: I don't always test my code, but when I do, I do it in production.
author: The Most Interesting Man in the World
